name: Sphinx
description: A Large Monstrosity with an imposing presence, the Sphinx boasts a lion-like body and a humanoid head. It has powerful claws and a regal demeanor, symbolizing wisdom.
memorable: The Sphinx is immune to divination effects and is hard to read, making it a mysterious and unpredictable opponent.
goals: Often serves as a guardian of knowledge and wisdom, posing challenges to those seeking information.
relations: Related to other mystical creatures and often associated with guardianship.
environment: Typically found in ancient ruins, temples, or other places of significance and knowledge.
strengths: High armor class and hit points, immunity to psychic damage, and considerable spellcasting abilities.
weaknesses: Not particularly fast, which may make it vulnerable to agile foes.
attacks: Makes two claw attacks per turn, dealing significant slashing damage.
most_powerful_ability: Planar Jaunt allows it to transport up to eight willing creatures to different planes or times.
senses: Possesses truesight up to 120 feet, enabling it to see through illusions and concealment.
skills: Skilled in arcana, history, perception, and religion, reflecting its vast knowledge with high bonuses.
additional_information: Immune to being charmed, frightened, paralyzed, or stunned.
Can cast a variety of powerful spells, including Flame Strike and Dispel Magic.
Inscrutable ability makes it difficult to gauge its intentions.
Can double its speed with the Speed Time ability for tactical advantages.
spellcasting: Innate spellcasting allows it to cast numerous spells, requiring no material components.
